args.natural_language_statement: Translate the following to Lean4: Let p > q be primes with q | (p - 1). Then any two nonabelian groups of order p*q are isomorphic. End the Lean theorem with := by sorry and import Mathlib at the top. Use types and classes from Mathlib (Group, Fintype, CommGroup, MulEquiv).

result:

open Tactic

open Lean.Elab.Command in

/-- Based on the full conversation history and the provided examples (if any), generate or correct the Lean4 code to satisfy the user's original request. If the last message was a tool error, fix the code. -/

example (a b : ℕ) : a + b = b + a := sorry"}

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Herstein, Ex. 2.8.15: If p > q are primes with q | (p - 1), then any two nonabelian
    groups of order p * q are isomorphic. -/
theorem Herstein_exercise_2_8_15 (p q : ℕ) (hp : Nat.Prime p) (hq : Nat.Prime q) (hpq : p > q)
  (hd : q ∣ p - 1) :
  ∀ (G H : Type) [Group G] [Fintype G] [Group H] [Fintype H],
    Fintype.card G = p * q → Fintype.card H = p * q →
    ¬ CommGroup G → ¬ CommGroup H → MulEquiv G H := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-- Herstein, Ex. 2.8.15: If p > q are primes with q | (p - 1), then any two nonabelian
    groups of order p * q are isomorphic. -/
theorem Herstein_exercise_2_8_15 (p q : ℕ) (hp : Nat.Prime p) (hq : Nat.Prime q) (hpq : p > q)
  (hd : q ∣ p - 1) :
  ∀ (G H : Type) [Group G] [Fintype G] [Group H] [Fintype H],
    Fintype.card G = p * q → Fintype.card H = p * q →
    (∃ x y : G, x * y ≠ y * x) → (∃ x y : H, x * y ≠ y * x) → G ≃* H := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-- Herstein, Ex. 2.8.15: If p > q are primes with q | (p - 1), then any two nonabelian
    groups of order p * q are isomorphic. -/
theorem Herstein_exercise_2_8_15 (p q : ℕ) (hp : Nat.Prime p) (hq : Nat.Prime q) (hpq : p > q)
  (hd : q ∣ p - 1) :
  ∀ (G H : Type) [Group G] [Fintype G] [Group H] [Fintype H],
    Fintype.card G = p * q → Fintype.card H = p * q →
    (∃ x y : G, x * y ≠ y * x) → (∃ x y : H, x * y ≠ y * x) →
    Nonempty (G ≃* H) := by sorry
